title: Kids Screen Time Analysis
text:
Wilcoxon test (optional)
The Mann-Whitney and Wilxon tests are nonparametric tests of location. â€œNonparametricâ€ means, that the general location of the distributions is compared and not a parameter like the mean. This makes the test independent of distributional assumptions, but can sometimes lead to a vague interpretations.

Chi-squared test and Fisherâ€™s exact test (optional)
Introduction
Taken from Agresti (2002), Fisherâ€™s Tea Drinker:
â€œA British woman claimed to be able to distinguish whether milk or tea was added to the cup first. To test, she was given 8 cups of tea, in four of which milk was added first. The null hypothesis is that there is no association between the true order of pouring and the womanâ€™s guess, the alternative that there is a positive association (that the odds ratio is greater than 1).â€

11-13 Years ğŸš¨ - Max 3h/day - Ratio â‰¥ 0.5 - Control devices - Monitor sleep

Les donnÃ©es montrent une rÃ©elle prÃ©occupation de santÃ© publique : 85,8% des enfants indiens dÃ©passent les recommandations de temps dâ€™Ã©cran, avec 67,1% prÃ©sentant des impacts sur la santÃ©.

Actions prioritaires : 1. ğŸ¯ Cibler les 11-13 ans (groupe Ã  risque le plus Ã©levÃ©)
2. ğŸ“š Promouvoir le contenu Ã©ducatif (effet protecteur ~20%)
3. ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘§ Sensibilisation parentale
